data.quote: Going to the woods is going home
data.author: John Muir

data.quote: We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children.
data.author: Chief Seattle

data.quote: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
data.author: Amelia Erhard

data.quote: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: Look deeply into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Mountains are not stadiums where I satisfy my ambition to achieve, they are the cathedrals where I practice my religion.
data.author: Anatoli Boukreev

data.quote: It’s easier to go down a hill than up it but the view is much better at the top.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: There is no such thing as bad weather, just soft people.
data.author: Bill Bowerman

data.quote: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
data.author: unknown

data.quote: Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts.
data.author: Rachel Carlson

data.quote: Nothing is more beautiful than the loveliness of the woods before sunrise.
data.author: George Washington Carver

data.quote: Somewhere between the bottom of the climb and the summit is the answer to the mystery why we climb.
data.author: Greg Child

data.quote: Each fresh peak ascended teaches something.
data.author: Sir Martin Conway

data.quote: A man does not climb a mountain without bringing some of it away with him, and leaving something of himself upon it.
data.author: Sir Martin Conway

data.quote: Most men take the straight and narrow. A few take the road less traveled. I chose to cut through the woods.
data.author: unknown

data.quote: I’ve learned that everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you’re climbing it.
data.author: Andy Rooney

data.quote: Go out, go out I beg of you And taste the beauty of the wild. Behold the miracle of the earth with all the wonder of a child.
data.author: Edna Jaques

data.quote: Life is a fatal adventure. It can only have one end. So why not make it as far-ranging and free as possible.
data.author: Alexander Eliot

data.quote: Adventure is not outside man; it is within.
data.author: George Eliot
